heading: shooter surrenders
subheading: buford furrow, the suspect police had sought in the tuesday shooting at the north valley jewish community center near los angeles turned himself in to authorities in las vegas early on wednesday. five people -- including three children -- were wounded in the shooting, when a gunman sprayed the lobby of the building with more than 70 bullets from what was believed to be a 9-mm weapon. furrow has ties to hate groups in the us northwest, including aryan nation, the order, and christian identity.
author: wired staff
